Relevance / Notes: [READ #2] This is the core 'how' for the HAR component. It details the 1D-CNN-BiLSTM model and the 'lab-to-life' problem.

Relevance / Notes: [READ #3] The foundational dataset your HAR model is based on. Essential to understand its inputs, outputs, and limitations.

Relevance / Notes: [READ #4] This is the 'why' and 'for whom'. It explains the problem of clinician workflow integration, which your RAG-LLM pipeline solves.

Paper Title: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) in Healthcare: A Comprehensive Review
Relevance / Notes: [READ #5] The core 'how' for your LLM component. A full review of the RAG technique you are using.

Paper Title: Evaluating large language models on medical evidence summarization
Relevance / Notes: [READ #6] Critical context for *why* RAG is necessary. Discusses LLM 'hallucinations' and factual inconsistency in medicine.

Paper Title: Domain adaptation for inertial measurement unit-based human activity recognition: A survey
Relevance / Notes: [READ #7] This survey defines your core 'problem statement': the 'lab-to-life' gap and domain shift for IMU sensors.

Paper Title: Transfer learning in human activity recognition: A survey
Relevance / Notes: [READ #8] This survey details your 'solution' to the problem: Transfer Learning, which is what you did by fine-tuning the ADAMSense model.

Paper Title: Deep learning for sensor-based activity recognition: A survey
Relevance / Notes: [READ #9] A foundational survey on DL for HAR. Establishes the 'state-of-the-art' that your 1D-CNN-BiLSTM model builds upon.

Paper Title: machine learning operations: a survey on MLOps
Relevance / Notes: [READ #10] The best starting point for your MLOps chapter. A broad survey covering the entire lifecycle.

Paper Title: MLOps for Wearable-based Human Activity Recognition

Paper Title: Heterogeneity Human Activity Recognition Dataset

Paper Title: Self-Supervised Human Activity Recognition Using Wearable Inertial Sensors
Relevance / Notes: Introduces SSL for IMU data; reduces dependency on labeled data; highly scalable approach for long-term wearable pipelines; useful for data-scarce clinical environments and pretraining before fine-tuning. Helps when adding LLM/RAG reasoning on top of embeddings.
Thesis Section:
- Ch.3 Data Pipeline (preprocessing + augmentation)
- Ch.4 Model Design (SSL pretraining)
- Ch.5 MLOps Scalability (label scarcity + automatic training)

Paper Title: Wearable Sensors for Mental Health Monitoring: A Comprehensive Review
